results.title: In touch
results.creator_credit: University of Bristol, George Brandt and Veronica Sherborne
results.brief_description: This film shows how following directions, student teachers in the first part of the film demonstrate dance movement geared to achieving certain results with mentally retarded children. During the second part the students work with individual children. Throughout, maxims of educational psychology are demonstrated.

results.title: In too deep
results.creator_credit: Media World Productions, John Tatoulis and Colin South
results.brief_description: Mack is an anti-social young gangster who plots to hold up a bank. The police and a rival underwold gang are pursuing him because he has an incriminating tape. An encounter with steamy jazz singer Wendy abruptly halts his criminal activites and, throwing caution to the wind, the two embark on a tempestuous relationship which becomes an all consuming obsession. Despite the danger, the two lovers live only for the moment and on the edge of tragedy. Cast includes Hugo Race, Santha Press, Rebekah Elmalogou, John Flaus and Dominic Sweeny.

results.title: In time of pestilence. The Pythoness
results.creator_credit: BFI, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, John Halas, Joan Maude and Michael Warne
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings”.
The third part of a series devised by Joan Maude and Michael Warre incorporating the works of writers, painters and musicians to create an experimental animated film. This part consists of two short films. ‘In time of pestilence’ by Thomas Nashe, narrated by Robert Harris, drawings by Michael Ayrton (3:18 mins). ‘The Pythoness’ by Kathleen Raine, narrated by Mary Morris, drawings by Henry Moore (2:00 mins). Photography by W. Traylor and R. Turk, music by Matyas Seiber, edited by Jack King.

results.title: In this situation again = In this place again
results.brief_description:
This is a documentary film about the friendship between an inmate at Bendigo Prison, Shane Lovett, and a young Koorie called Tim from Heywood. Tim visits Shane at the prison to talk about the music he has been making and what life is like in prison.
Music: “Barganji River Tribe” Shane Lovett and Sonny Wise; “Only Dreaming” Shane Lovett; “So Go” Shane Lovett

results.title: In the year of the pig
results.creator_credit: Monday Film Production Company and Emile de Antonio
results.brief_description: A graphically terse indictment of the U.S. involvement in Vietnam. The film uses archival footage, newsclips and interviews to present both a background history to the war and a condemnation of the foreign policy of the U.S. towards South-East Asia. Features footage and interviews of J. F. Kennedy, Eisenhower, Nixon and L. B. Johnson as well as the commentary of soldiers, activists and journalists. The film had a considerable impact and effect on the Australian anti-war movement.

results.title: In the winter dark
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, R B Films, Rosemary Blight and James Bogle
results.brief_description: Maurice Stubbs has a heavy heart, remorse and broken dreams consume him as someone or something is slowly killing the animals, disembowelling them in fact, around his secluded farm. His usual sense of total isolation is heightened by the inexplicable events that are occurring, and contradict the notion of an idyllic country existence. Maurice, along with his wife Ida and two other frightened residents, city fugitive Jacob and modern city girl Ronnie form an uneasy alliance in search of things they do not know, in places they should not be. For to confront the beast that seems to have no tangible existence is to confront their own internal demons. Based on the novel of the same name by Tim Winton. Cast includes Brenda Blethyn, Ray Barrett, Richard Roxburgh and Miranda Otto.

results.title: In the west
results.creator_credit: B F P, RKO Radio Pictures and Ronald Haines
results.brief_description: In the west refers to West Country of England, Devon and Cornwall. Filmed during World War II, shows fishermen who work at sea and then come home to grow potatoes and tomatoes for the War effort. Footage is shown of lobster and oyster production under government regulations. Also shows the villagers joining in a vital lifeboat practice with everyone downing tools to man the lifeboat - a very special service during war time. Narrator: Frank Phillips

results.title: In the Wake of the Stars
results.creator_credit: Cinesound, Bede Whiteman and Mark McDonald
results.brief_description: Aviation came quickly in Australia. In the early days reliable DC3’s carried everyone and everything. Then new faster and more comfortable aircraft were sought: the Fokker Friendship from Holland, the super Viscount from France and turbo jets from America. During training flights the attractions of gracious Amsterdam, gay Paris, England’s spring, New York’s people, Rome’s buildings and Australia’s scenic attractions are presented.

results.title: In the wake of the Bounty
results.brief_description: Chauvel’s first “talkie”, this film merges documentary footage and dramatic historical reconstruction. Re-enacts the mutiny led by Fletcher Christian (Errol Flynn) in 1789 against the master of the Bounty, William Bligh (Mayne Lynton), and depicts the fate of the mutineers on Tahiti and remote Pitcairn Island. Provides a unique and spectacular record of the life of the isolated community of Pitcairn in 1932 with most of the inhabitants being descendants of the Bounty mutineers. This was the first film shot on Pitcairn Island and the first in which the Australian actor, Errol Flynn, appeared. The dramatised footage was shot at the Cinesound Studio in Sydney. Cast also includes Victor Gouriet and John Warwick

results.title: In the wake of Mendana
results.creator_credit: Western Pacific High Commission and Norman K Wallis
results.brief_description: An impression of life in the British Solomon Islands. Shows the natural vegetation of the islands; native villages; schools; hospitals; churches; industries; activities of the natives - singing, dancing, canoe racing. Mentions the history of the islands and the administration.
